comments.author: aminehochlef
comments.text: In 2026, can you explain more of the core concepts surrounding money, the monetary system, economies, basics of finances. In short: financial literacy, that would benefit people a whole lot more that learning about politics, don't get me wrong, the episodes surrounding politics are enjoyable, but financial literacy is more important. This episode was a very good example of what I'm describing. Ending with a quote from a movie: I do have a test today. that wasn't bullshit. It's on European socialism. I mean, really, what's the point? I'm not European. I don't plan on being European. So who cares if they're socialists? They could be fascist anarchists. It still doesn't change the fact that I don't own a car. ~ Ferris Bueller
comments.question: I mean, really, what's the point? I'm not European

comments.author: ahmedalameldien765
comments.text: AI engineer here. best AI model depends heavily on your task/work. for programming (heavy coding), claude code "Opus 4.5" (Anthropic) is the best currently, but for debugging, reasoning, and finding very deep errors, Codex "GPT 5.2 Xhigh" (Chatgpt) is really good. for heavy reasoning and complex tasks in general, especially in the research domain, GhatGPT 5.2 Thinking is the best. if i spend 10 hrs daily working, i use claude code for 9 hours, and codex for just 1
